output:
INIDISP ($2100) - Force blank ON.

This writes to the INIDISP register at $2100:
- Bit 7 = 1: Force blank enabled (screen off)
- Bits 0-3 = 0: Brightness minimum

INIDISP controls display blanking and brightness. Force blank is required for VRAM access outside V-blank.

INIDISP ($2100) - Display ON, max brightness.

This writes $0F to INIDISP:
- Bit 7 = 0: Force blank OFF (display active)
- Bits 0-3 = $F: Maximum brightness (15)

INIDISP is written after initialization to enable the screen.

INIDISP ($2100) - Force blank with brightness preserved.

Writes $8F to INIDISP register:
- Bit 7 = 1: Force blank ON
- Bits 0-3 = $F: Brightness = 15 (preserved for later)

Common during VRAM updates or scene transitions.

INIDISP ($2100) - Force blank OFF, zero brightness.

Writes $00 to INIDISP:
- Bit 7 = 0: Display enabled
- Bits 0-3 = 0: Brightness at minimum (black)

Used for fade-to-black effects by gradually decreasing brightness.

INIDISP ($2100) - Clears display settings.

STZ stores zero to INIDISP at $2100:
- Display ON (no force blank)
- Brightness = 0 (black screen)

INIDISP register controls PPU display state.

BGMODE ($2105) - Sets Mode 1.

Writes to BGMODE register at $2105:
- Bits 0-2 = 1: BG Mode 1
- Bits 4-7 = 0: All BGs use 8x8 tiles

BGMODE Mode 1: BG1/BG2 = 16 colors (4bpp), BG3 = 4 colors (2bpp).

BGMODE ($2105) - Sets Mode 7.

Writes $07 to BGMODE:
- Bits 0-2 = 7: BG Mode 7 (rotation/scaling)

BGMODE Mode 7 provides matrix transformation for pseudo-3D effects.

BGMODE ($2105) - Mode 1 with 16x16 tiles.

Writes to BGMODE:
- Bits 0-2 = 1: Mode 1
- Bit 4 = 1: BG1 uses 16x16 tiles

BGMODE controls background graphics mode and tile sizes.

VMAIN ($2115) - VRAM increment on high byte.

Writes to VMAIN register at $2115:
- Bit 7 = 1: Increment address after writing to VMDATAH ($2119)
- Bits 0-1 = 0: Increment by 1 word

VMAIN controls how VRAM address increments during writes.

VMAIN ($2115) - VRAM increment on low byte.

Writes $00 to VMAIN:
- Bit 7 = 0: Increment after writing to VMDATAL ($2118)
- Bits 0-1 = 0: Increment by 1 word

VMAIN is set before VRAM operations.

VMAIN ($2115) - Increment by 32 words.

Writes $81 to VMAIN register:
- Bit 7 = 1: Increment on high byte write
- Bits 0-1 = 1: Increment by 32 words

VMAIN 32-word increment is used for column-based tilemap updates.

VMADDL/VMADDH ($2116-$2117) - Sets VRAM address to $0000.

VMADDL ($2116) and VMADDH ($2117) form the 16-bit VRAM word address.
Writing zeros sets address to start of VRAM.

VRAM is 64KB addressed as 32K words.

VMADDL/VMADDH ($2116-$2117) - Sets VRAM address to $1000.

16-bit write to VMADDL sets both low and high bytes.
VRAM address $1000 is commonly used for tilemap data.

VMADDL/H must be set before VRAM read/write operations.

CGADD ($2121) - Sets palette address to 0.

Writes to CGADD register at $2121:
- Sets palette index for CGDATA writes
- $00 = first color (typically transparent)

CGADD points to one of 256 palette entries.

CGADD ($2121) - Sets palette address to 128.

Writes $80 to CGADD:
- Palette index 128 (second half of palette)

CGADD is used before palette uploads to set starting color.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$1F
STA $2122
LDA #$00
STA $2122
output:
CGDATA ($2122) - Writes one color (red).

CGDATA at $2122 is written twice per color:
- First write: Low byte ($1F = red component)
- Second write: High byte ($00)

SNES uses 15-bit BGR: %0BBBBBGGGGGRRRRR
$001F = pure red (max red, no green/blue).

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$00
STA $2122
LDA #$7C
STA $2122
output:
CGDATA ($2122) - Writes one color (blue).

Two writes to CGDATA for 15-bit color:
- Low byte: $00
- High byte: $7C

$7C00 = %01111100 00000000 = pure blue.
CGDATA auto-increments CGADD after each color.

TM ($212C) - Enables BG1 on main screen.

Writes to TM register at $212C:
- Bit 0 = 1: BG1 enabled

TM controls which layers appear on the main screen.
Bits: 0=BG1, 1=BG2, 2=BG3, 3=BG4, 4=Sprites.

TM ($212C) - Enables BG1 and sprites.

Writes $11 to TM:
- Bit 0 = 1: BG1 enabled
- Bit 4 = 1: Sprites enabled

TM is the main screen layer enable register.

TM ($212C) - Enables all layers.

Writes $1F to TM:
- Bits 0-3 = 1: All four BG layers
- Bit 4 = 1: Sprites

TM controls main screen visibility for all 5 layers.

NMITIMEN ($4200) - Enables NMI and joypad auto-read.

Writes to NMITIMEN register at $4200:
- Bit 7 = 1: NMI enabled (V-blank interrupt)
- Bit 0 = 1: Joypad auto-read enabled

NMITIMEN is the main interrupt control register.

NMITIMEN ($4200) - Enables NMI only.

Writes $80 to NMITIMEN:
- Bit 7 = 1: NMI enabled
- Bit 0 = 0: Manual joypad read

NMITIMEN enables V-blank interrupt for game loop timing.

NMITIMEN ($4200) - Enables joypad auto-read only.

Writes $01 to NMITIMEN:
- Bit 7 = 0: NMI disabled
- Bit 0 = 1: Joypad auto-read enabled

NMITIMEN without NMI is used during initialization.

NMITIMEN ($4200) - Disables all interrupts.

Clears NMITIMEN register:
- NMI disabled
- H/V IRQ disabled
- Joypad auto-read disabled

NMITIMEN is often cleared during initialization.

MDMAEN ($420B) - Triggers DMA on channel 0.

Writes to MDMAEN register at $420B:
- Bit 0 = 1: Enable DMA channel 0

MDMAEN starts DMA transfer. CPU halts until complete.
Channel bits: 0=$01, 1=$02, 2=$04, 3=$08, etc.

MDMAEN ($420B) - Triggers DMA on channels 0 and 1.

Writes $03 to MDMAEN:
- Bit 0 = 1: Channel 0
- Bit 1 = 1: Channel 1

MDMAEN can trigger multiple DMA channels simultaneously.

MDMAEN ($420B) - Triggers DMA on channel 7.

Writes $80 to MDMAEN:
- Bit 7 = 1: Channel 7 enabled

MDMAEN register enables any of 8 DMA channels (0-7).

HDMAEN ($420C) - Enables HDMA on channel 0.

Writes to HDMAEN register at $420C:
- Bit 0 = 1: HDMA channel 0 active

HDMAEN enables per-scanline DMA for effects like gradients and wavy backgrounds.

HDMAEN ($420C) - Disables all HDMA.

Clears HDMAEN register to stop all HDMA channels.

HDMAEN should be disabled during VRAM updates.

RDNMI ($4210) - Reads NMI status and clears flag.

Reads from RDNMI register at $4210:
- Bit 7: NMI occurred (reading clears this)
- Bits 0-3: CPU version

RDNMI must be read to acknowledge NMI.

RDNMI ($4210) - Tests NMI flag.

BIT instruction reads RDNMI and sets N flag from bit 7.

RDNMI reading clears the NMI flag. Used in NMI handler.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA $4212
AND #$01
BNE WaitJoy
output:
HVBJOY ($4212) - Waits for joypad read to complete.

Reads HVBJOY register at $4212:
- Bit 0: Joypad auto-read in progress

HVBJOY must be polled before reading joypad data.

HVBJOY ($4212) - Waits for V-blank.

BIT reads HVBJOY, N flag = bit 7 (V-blank status).
Loop until bit 7 = 1 (V-blank active).

HVBJOY is used for frame synchronization.

DMAP0 ($4300) - DMA mode 1 (two-register write).

Writes to DMAP0 register at $4300:
- Bits 0-2 = 1: Mode 1 (write to two consecutive registers)
- Bit 7 = 0: A-bus to B-bus (CPU to PPU)

DMAP0 mode 1 is used for VRAM transfers via $2118/$2119.

DMAP0 ($4300) - DMA mode 0 (single register).

Writes $00 to DMAP0:
- Bits 0-2 = 0: Mode 0 (one register)
- Bit 7 = 0: CPU to PPU direction

DMAP0 mode 0 for OAM or single-byte transfers.

DMAP0 ($4300) - DMA reverse direction.

Writes $80 to DMAP0:
- Bit 7 = 1: B-bus to A-bus (PPU to CPU)

DMAP0 reverse DMA reads from PPU registers.

BBAD0 ($4301) - DMA target is VRAM data low.

Writes to BBAD0 register at $4301:
- $18 = low byte of $2118 (VMDATAL)

BBAD0 sets the B-bus destination. Combined with mode 1, writes to $2118/$2119.

BBAD0 ($4301) - DMA target is palette data.

Writes $22 to BBAD0:
- $22 = low byte of $2122 (CGDATA)

BBAD0 for palette DMA transfers.

BBAD0 ($4301) - DMA target is OAM data.

Writes $04 to BBAD0:
- $04 = low byte of $2104 (OAMDATA)

BBAD0 for sprite table DMA uploads.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #<SourceData
STA $4302
LDA #>SourceData
STA $4303
output:
A1T0L/A1T0H ($4302-$4303) - Sets DMA source address.

Writes 16-bit address within bank:
- A1T0L ($4302): Low byte of source
- A1T0H ($4303): High byte of source

A1T0 is the source address for DMA channel 0.

A1B0 ($4304) - Sets DMA source bank.

Writes bank byte to A1B0 register:
- ^Label syntax gets the bank byte

A1B0 completes the 24-bit DMA source address.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
REP #$20
LDA #$1000
STA $4305
SEP #$20
output:
DAS0L/DAS0H ($4305-$4306) - Sets DMA size to 4096 bytes.

16-bit write to DAS0:
- $1000 = 4096 bytes to transfer

DAS0 is the byte count. $0000 means 65536 bytes.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$00
STA $4305
LDA #$02
STA $4306
output:
DAS0L/DAS0H ($4305-$4306) - Sets DMA size to 512 bytes.

Writes $0200 to DAS0:
- 512 bytes for tilemap transfer

DAS0 register pair holds transfer byte count.

JOY1L ($4218) - Reads joypad 1 buttons.

Reads from JOY1L register at $4218 after auto-read:
- Bit 7: A button
- Bit 6: X button
- Bit 5: L button
- Bit 4: R button

JOY1L contains A, X, L, R buttons for player 1.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
REP #$20
LDA $4218
SEP #$20
output:
JOY1L/JOY1H ($4218-$4219) - Reads full joypad state.

16-bit read of JOY1 register pair:
- Low byte: A, X, L, R (and more)
- High byte: B, Y, Select, Start, Up, Down, Left, Right

JOY1L/H contain all button states after auto-read.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$80
STA $2115
LDX #$0000
STX $2116
output:
Sets up VRAM address for writing.

$2115 is VMAIN (VRAM Address Increment Mode):
- Bit 7 = 1: Increment on writes to $2119 (VMDATAH)
- Bits 0-1 = 0: Increment by 1 word

$2116-$2117 is VMADDL/H (VRAM word address):
- Set to $0000 (start of VRAM)

This prepares for sequential VRAM writes using $2118/$2119.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$01
STA $4300
LDA #$18
STA $4301
output:
Configures DMA channel 0 for VRAM transfer.

$4300 is DMAP0 (DMA Control):
- Bit 7 = 0: Transfer A-bus → B-bus (CPU → PPU)
- Bits 0-2 = 1: Mode 1 (write to two registers: $2118, $2119)

$4301 is BBAD0 (B-bus destination):
- $18 = Low byte of $2118 (VMDATAL)

Mode 1 writes alternating bytes to $2118 and $2119 for 16-bit VRAM transfers.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
REP #$20
LDA #SourceData
STA $4302
SEP #$20
LDA #^SourceData
STA $4304
output:
Sets DMA source address (24-bit).

$4302-$4303 (A1T0L/H): 16-bit address within bank
$4304 (A1B0): Bank byte

Uses REP/SEP to efficiently write 16-bit address, then 8-bit bank.
The ^SourceData syntax gets the bank byte of the label.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$80
STA $2100
LDA #$80
STA $2115
STZ $2116
STZ $2117
LDA #$01
STA $4300
LDA #$18
STA $4301
LDA #<TileData
STA $4302
LDA #>TileData
STA $4303
LDA #^TileData
STA $4304
LDA #<TileDataEnd-TileData
STA $4305
LDA #>TileDataEnd-TileData
STA $4306
LDA #$01
STA $420B
output:
Complete DMA transfer of tile data to VRAM.

1. Force blank on ($2100) - required for VRAM access
2. Set VRAM increment mode ($2115 = $80, increment on high byte write)
3. Set VRAM destination address to $0000 ($2116-$2117)
4. Configure DMA channel 0:
   - Mode 1: Two-register write ($4300 = $01)
   - Target: VMDATAL at $2118 ($4301 = $18)
   - Source: TileData address ($4302-$4304)
   - Size: Length of tile data ($4305-$4306)
5. Trigger DMA ($420B = $01)

This is the standard pattern for uploading graphics to VRAM.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
STZ $2121
LDA #$00
STA $2122
LDA #$7C
STA $2122
output:
Writes a single color to palette index 0.

$2121 is CGADD (palette address):
- $00 = First color slot

$2122 is CGDATA (color data, write twice):
- First write: Low byte ($00)
- Second write: High byte ($7C)

SNES uses 15-bit BGR: %0BBBBBGG GGGRRRRR
$7C00 = %01111100 00000000 = Blue (max blue, no green/red).

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$00
STA $2121
LDA #$01
STA $4300
LDA #$22
STA $4301
output:
Sets up DMA for palette transfer.

$2121 = $00: Start at palette index 0
$4300 = $01: Mode 1 (two-register write)
$4301 = $22: Target CGDATA ($2122)

Palette DMA writes color bytes in pairs (low, high) automatically.
Used for bulk palette uploads (faster than manual writes).

Resets OAM address to 0.

$2102-$2103 is OAMADDL/H:
- Sets the sprite table write address
- OAM holds 128 sprites × 4 bytes + 32 bytes high table

After this, writes to $2104 (OAMDATA) go to the start of sprite table.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$00
STA $4300
LDA #$04
STA $4301
output:
Configures DMA for OAM transfer.

$4300 = $00: Mode 0 (single register write)
$4301 = $04: Target OAMDATA ($2104)

Mode 0 writes sequential bytes to one register.
Used for uploading 544-byte sprite table to OAM.

Sets BG1 tilemap to VRAM $0000, 32×32 tiles.

$2107 is BG1SC:
- Bits 2-7 = 0: Base address $0000
- Bits 0-1 = 0: 32×32 tile map (1 screen)

Address formula: Base = (value & $FC) << 8.

Sets BG1 tilemap to VRAM $0400, 32×32 tiles.

$2107 is BG1SC:
- Bits 2-7 = $01: Base address $0400
- Bits 0-1 = 0: 32×32 tiles

Common setup: Tilemap at $0400, tile graphics at $0000.

Sets BG1 character base to VRAM $1000.

$210B is BG12NBA:
- Bits 0-3 = 1: BG1 tiles at $1000
- Bits 4-7 = 0: BG2 tiles at $0000

Address formula: Base = (nibble) << 12.

Enables NMI, V-count IRQ, and auto-joypad.

$4200 is NMITIMEN:
- Bit 7 = 1: NMI enabled
- Bit 5 = 1: V-count IRQ enabled
- Bit 0 = 1: Auto-joypad enabled

V-count IRQ fires at scanline specified in $4209-$420A.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA $10
STA $4202
LDA $11
STA $4203
NOP
NOP
NOP
NOP
LDA $4216
STA $12
LDA $4217
STA $13
output:
Hardware multiplication: $10 × $11 → $12-$13.

$4202 (WRMPYA): First multiplicand
$4203 (WRMPYB): Second multiplicand (triggers multiply)
$4216-$4217 (RDMPYL/H): 16-bit result

4 NOPs (or 8 cycles) wait for multiply to complete.
Result is unsigned 8-bit × 8-bit = 16-bit product.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
REP #$20
LDA $10
STA $4204
SEP #$20
LDA $12
STA $4206
NOP
NOP
NOP
NOP
NOP
NOP
NOP
NOP
REP #$20
LDA $4214
STA $14
SEP #$20
output:
Hardware division: $10-$11 ÷ $12 → quotient $14-$15.

$4204-$4205 (WRDIVL/H): 16-bit dividend
$4206 (WRDIVB): 8-bit divisor (triggers divide)
$4214-$4215 (RDDIVL/H): 16-bit quotient
$4216-$4217 (RDMPYL/H): 16-bit remainder

8 NOPs (16 cycles) wait for division to complete.
Result: 16-bit ÷ 8-bit = 16-bit quotient + 16-bit remainder.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
-
LDA $4212
AND #$01
BNE -
LDA $4218
STA $10
LDA $4219
STA $11
output:
Waits for auto-joypad, then reads controller 1.

$4212 is HVBJOY:
- Bit 0: Auto-joypad in progress

Wait loop ensures joypad read is complete before accessing data.

$4218-$4219 (JOY1L/H) contains:
- $4218: A, X, L, R buttons
- $4219: B, Y, Select, Start, D-pad

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$00
STA $4300
LDA #$21
STA $4301
LDA #<HDMATable
STA $4302
LDA #>HDMATable
STA $4303
LDA #^HDMATable
STA $4304
LDA #$01
STA $420C
output:
Sets up HDMA channel 0 for palette effects.

$4300 = $00: Mode 0, A→B (indirect table to PPU)
$4301 = $21: Target CGADD ($2121)
$4302-$4304: HDMA table address

$420C = $01: Enable HDMA channel 0

HDMA transfers data each scanline based on a table.
Used for gradient effects, water reflections, etc.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$02
STA $4300
LDA #$0D
STA $4301
output:
HDMA for BG1 horizontal scroll (parallax).

$4300 = $02: Mode 2 (write same byte to register twice)
$4301 = $0D: Target BG1HOFS ($210D)

Mode 2 writes each table byte twice, good for 16-bit scroll registers.
Creates parallax scrolling effects per scanline.

Mode 7 settings: Screen-over, repeat mode.

$211A is M7SEL:
- Bit 7 = 1: Fill with tile 0 outside map
- Bit 6 = 0: Normal (vs. fill with transparent)
- Bits 0-1 = 0: No flipping

Used for F-Zero style tracks where outside area shows sky/tile 0.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
LDA #$01
STA $211B
STZ $211B
STZ $211C
STZ $211C
STZ $211D
STZ $211D
LDA #$01
STA $211E
STZ $211E
output:
Sets Mode 7 identity matrix (no transformation).

Matrix registers (write twice each: low, high):
$211B (M7A) = $0100: cos(0) = 1.0
$211C (M7B) = $0000: sin(0) = 0
$211D (M7C) = $0000: -sin(0) = 0
$211E (M7D) = $0100: cos(0) = 1.0

Fixed-point format: 1 sign bit, 7 integer, 8 fraction.
$0100 = 1.0 in this format.

Waits for V-blank to start.

$4212 is HVBJOY:
- Bit 7: V-blank flag (1 during V-blank)

BPL branches while bit 7 is 0 (not in V-blank).
Loop exits when V-blank begins.

Waits for V-blank to end.

$4212 is HVBJOY:
- Bit 7: V-blank flag

BMI branches while bit 7 is 1 (in V-blank).
Loop exits when active display begins.

Enables FastROM mode.

$420D is MEMSEL:
- Bit 0 = 1: FastROM (6 master cycles per ROM access)
- Bit 0 = 0: SlowROM (8 master cycles)

Only works if ROM supports fast timing. Speeds up execution ~25%.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
STZ $2181
STZ $2182
LDA #$7E
STA $2183
LDA #$08
STA $4300
LDA #$80
STA $4301
output:
Sets up DMA to clear WRAM.

$2181-$2183: WRAM address = $7E:0000 (start of WRAM)

$4300 = $08: Mode 0, fixed source (don't increment A-bus)
$4301 = $80: Target WMDATA ($2180)

With fixed source, same byte is written repeatedly.
Used to zero-fill WRAM at startup.

instruction:
Explain this 65816 code:
SEI
CLC
XCE
REP #$30
LDA #$0000
TCD
LDX #$01FF
TXS
SEP #$30
output:
Standard SNES initialization sequence.

1. SEI: Disable IRQ interrupts
2. CLC + XCE: Switch to native 65816 mode (clear emulation)
3. REP #$30: 16-bit A, X, Y
4. LDA #$0000, TCD: Set direct page to $0000
5. LDX #$01FF, TXS: Set stack pointer to $01FF
6. SEP #$30: Back to 8-bit mode

This is the minimum CPU setup at game startup.

Writes to INIDISP ($2100).

Screen Display Register.

Bit fields: Bit 7: Force blank (1=screen off), Bits 0-3: Brightness (0=dark, F=max).

Writes to OBSEL ($2101).

Object Size and Character Address.

Bit fields: Bits 5-7: Sprite size, Bits 3-4: Name select, Bits 0-2: Base address.

Writes to BGMODE ($2105).

Background Mode and Tile Size.

Bit fields: Bits 0-2: BG mode (0-7), Bit 3: BG3 priority, Bits 4-7: BG tile sizes.

Writes to MOSAIC ($2106).

Screen Pixelation.

Bit fields: Bits 4-7: Mosaic size, Bits 0-3: BG enable flags.

Writes to BG1SC ($2107).

BG1 Tilemap Address and Size.

Bit fields: Bits 2-7: Base address, Bits 0-1: H/V mirror (0=32x32, 1=64x32, 2=32x64, 3=64x64).

Writes to VMAIN ($2115).

VRAM Address Increment Mode.

Bit fields: Bit 7: Increment on high/low, Bits 0-1: Increment amount (0=1, 1=32, 2=128).

Writes to VMADDL ($2116).

VRAM Address Low Byte.

Bit fields: Low 8 bits of VRAM word address.

Writes to VMADDH ($2117).

VRAM Address High Byte.

Bit fields: High 8 bits of VRAM word address.

Writes to VMDATAL ($2118).

VRAM Data Write Low.

Bit fields: Write low byte of VRAM data.

Writes to VMDATAH ($2119).

VRAM Data Write High.

Bit fields: Write high byte of VRAM data.

Writes to CGADD ($2121).

CGRAM (Palette) Address.

Bit fields: 8-bit palette index (0-255).

Writes to CGDATA ($2122).

CGRAM Data Write.

Bit fields: 15-bit BGR color (write twice: low then high).

Writes to TM ($212C).

Main Screen Designation.

Bit fields: Bit 4: OBJ, Bits 0-3: BG1-BG4 enable.

Writes to TS ($212D).

Sub Screen Designation.

Bit fields: Bit 4: OBJ, Bits 0-3: BG1-BG4 enable.

Writes to CGWSEL ($2130).

Color Math Control A.

Bit fields: Bits 6-7: Clip colors, Bits 4-5: Prevent math, Bit 1: Subscreen, Bit 0: Direct color.

Writes to CGADSUB ($2131).

Color Math Control B.

Bit fields: Bit 7: Add/subtract, Bit 6: Half, Bits 0-5: Layer enable.

Writes to COLDATA ($2132).

Fixed Color Data.

Bit fields: Bit 7: Blue, Bit 6: Green, Bit 5: Red, Bits 0-4: Intensity.

Writes to SETINI ($2133).

Screen Mode/Video Select.

Bit fields: Bit 7: External sync, Bit 6: Mode 7 EXTBG, Bit 3: Pseudo-hires, Bit 2: Overscan, Bit 0: Interlace.

Writes to APUIO0 ($2140).

APU Communication Port 0.

Bit fields: Read/write 8-bit data to SPC700.

Writes to APUIO1 ($2141).

APU Communication Port 1.

Bit fields: Read/write 8-bit data to SPC700.

Writes to APUIO2 ($2142).

APU Communication Port 2.

Bit fields: Read/write 8-bit data to SPC700.

Writes to APUIO3 ($2143).

APU Communication Port 3.

Bit fields: Read/write 8-bit data to SPC700.

Writes to WMDATA ($2180).

WRAM Data Read/Write.

Bit fields: Sequential WRAM access (auto-increments address).

Writes to WMADDL ($2181).

WRAM Address Low.

Bit fields: Bits 0-7 of 17-bit WRAM address.

Writes to WMADDM ($2182).

WRAM Address Middle.

Bit fields: Bits 8-15 of 17-bit WRAM address.

Writes to WMADDH ($2183).

WRAM Address High.

Bit fields: Bit 0: Bank select (0=$7E, 1=$7F).

Writes to NMITIMEN ($4200).

Interrupt Enable Register.

Bit fields: Bit 7: NMI enable, Bits 4-5: IRQ mode, Bit 0: Auto-joypad read.

Writes to WRIO ($4201).

Programmable I/O Port.

Bit fields: I/O port output; Bit 7 triggers PPU counter latch.

Writes to WRMPYA ($4202).

Multiplicand A.

Bit fields: 8-bit unsigned multiplicand.

Writes to WRMPYB ($4203).

Multiplicand B.

Bit fields: 8-bit unsigned multiplier (triggers multiply on write).

Writes to WRDIVL ($4204).

Dividend Low.

Bit fields: Low 8 bits of 16-bit dividend.

Writes to WRDIVH ($4205).

Dividend High.

Bit fields: High 8 bits of 16-bit dividend.

Writes to WRDIVB ($4206).

Divisor.

Bit fields: 8-bit divisor (triggers divide on write).

Writes to HTIMEL ($4207).

H-Count Timer Low.

Bit fields: Low 8 bits of H-counter compare value.

Writes to VTIMEL ($4209).

V-Count Timer Low.

Bit fields: Low 8 bits of V-counter compare value.

Writes to MDMAEN ($420B).

DMA Enable.

Bit fields: Bits 0-7: Enable DMA channels 0-7 (triggers transfer).

Writes to HDMAEN ($420C).

HDMA Enable.

Bit fields: Bits 0-7: Enable HDMA channels 0-7.

Writes to MEMSEL ($420D).

ROM Access Speed.

Bit fields: Bit 0: 1=FastROM (6 cycles), 0=SlowROM (8 cycles).

Writes to RDNMI ($4210).

NMI Flag and Version.

Bit fields: Bit 7: NMI flag (cleared on read), Bits 0-3: CPU version.

Writes to TIMEUP ($4211).

IRQ Flag.

Bit fields: Bit 7: IRQ flag (cleared on read).

Writes to HVBJOY ($4212).

PPU Status.

Bit fields: Bit 7: V-blank, Bit 6: H-blank, Bit 0: Auto-joypad in progress.

Writes to RDDIVL ($4214).

Division Quotient Low.

Bit fields: Low 8 bits of division result.

Writes to RDDIVH ($4215).

Division Quotient High.

Bit fields: High 8 bits of division result.

Writes to RDMPYL ($4216).

Multiply/Remainder Low.

Bit fields: Low byte of multiply product or division remainder.

Writes to RDMPYH ($4217).

Multiply/Remainder High.

Bit fields: High byte of multiply product or division remainder.

Writes to JOY1L ($4218).

Joypad 1 Data Low.

Bit fields: A, X, L, R buttons.

Writes to JOY1H ($4219).

Joypad 1 Data High.

Bit fields: B, Y, Select, Start, Up, Down, Left, Right.

Writes to DMAP0 ($4300).

DMA Channel 0 Control.

Bit fields: Bit 7: Direction (0=A→B, 1=B→A), Bits 0-2: Transfer mode.

Writes to BBAD0 ($4301).

DMA Channel 0 B-Bus Address.

Bit fields: PPU register address ($21xx) - just the low byte.

Writes to A1T0L ($4302).

DMA Channel 0 Source Address Low.

Bit fields: Low byte of source address.

Writes to A1T0H ($4303).

DMA Channel 0 Source Address High.

Bit fields: High byte of source address.

Writes to A1B0 ($4304).

DMA Channel 0 Source Bank.

Bit fields: Bank byte of source address.

Writes to DAS0L ($4305).

DMA Channel 0 Size Low.

Bit fields: Low byte of transfer size (0=65536 bytes).

Writes to DAS0H ($4306).

DMA Channel 0 Size High.

Bit fields: High byte of transfer size.
